pullrequest.title: Added a note about outdated Gazebo version in Ubuntu/ROS repos.

content.raw:
Thanks for the PR. I see different problems with how it is in this PR: not everyone will see `gazebo9` as a package coming from Ubuntu repositories \(i.e Xenial users\).  The ROS users need an special treatment at the moment of choosing a Gazebo version depending on the level of compatibility they need between ROS and Gazebo. I would prefer not to include particular cases in the tutorials \(like the note about the gazebo9 series at this moment of the year\). 

Let’s follow in [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo\_tutorials/pull-requests/547/added-note-about-ubuntu-official-packages/diff](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/547/added-note-about-ubuntu-official-packages/diff) if you don’t mind Martin.
content.html:
Thanks for the PR. I see different problems with how it is in this PR: not everyone will see gazebo9 as a package coming from Ubuntu repositories (i.e Xenial users). The ROS users need an special treatment at the moment of choosing a Gazebo version depending on the level of compatibility they need between ROS and Gazebo. I would prefer not to include particular cases in the tutorials (like the note about the gazebo9 series at this moment of the year).

Let’s follow in #!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/547/added-note-about-ubuntu-official-packages/diff if you don’t mind Martin.
